duties_responsibilities.duty: Contribute to the development and enhancement of cutting-edge observatory capabilities.
Support the design, troubleshooting, and maintenance of various mechanical and opto-mechanical systems.
Assemble, test, troubleshoot, and repair new and existing summit infrastructure equipment, encompassing various mechanical and infrastructure systems.
Design, analyze, test, and integrate new observatory capabilities and system upgrades, employing 3D computer-aided design (CAD) and finite element analysis (FEA).
Prepare technical documentation adhering to ASME GD&T and Drawing standards, developing installation and operations procedures, and coordinating with multidisciplinary teams.
Provide technical and project management support for subcontracts, overseeing design, analysis, fabrication, installation, and repair efforts.

Lead the summit installation of mechanical systems, working closely with project management, engineers, summit supervisors, and the installation team while prioritizing safety through rigorous engineering design and planning.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor of Science degree in mechanical engineering or a related field (Master's preferred)
